html:
• anchor

    Image credit: Acelab

    Following our previous look at an opening for a Preservation Architect at Architectural Resources Group (ARG), we are using this week’s edition of our Job Highlights series to explore an open role on Archinect Jobs for a Materials Research Specialist at Acelab.

    The remote role calls for an individual who will join the startup’s AEC Customer Experience team and assist in “implementing historical materials data and delivering targeted product recommendations” for customers. Among the requirements for the role are 3+ years of full-time experience in AEC, project delivery, or project management in the U.S, as well as expertise in materials selection for architectural projects.

    Why the role interests us

    The open role at Acelab allows us to take a closer look at one of several startups we have recently covered on Archinect. Founded by architects, the company describes itself as a “product research library built for architects, designers & contractors” whose mission is “modernizing the product research and selection process for design professionals.” 

    Earlier this year, the startup launched an AI-powered Materials Hub, which seeks to streamline the process of sourcing, specifying, and learning more about material products. The AI system is trained on data from over 100,000 building materials, and can provide details on aesthetics, performance, and sustainability as well as documentation for LEED and WELL. According to Acelab, the hub has been adopted by firms including BIG, SHoP, and AECOM. Back in 2023, meanwhile, the startup raised $5.3 million in funding.

    Acelab is one of several startups recently featured in our editorial. Earlier this year, we reported on two former executives from Autodesk who had raised $46 million for a new AI-driven startup seeking to become the "next-generation design platform for buildings.” Our Jobs Highlights series has also recently profiled a role at Samara, a housing startup created by a co-founder of Airbnb. Last July, meanwhile, a team of architects launched a new AI visualization platform following a $1.1 million investment.
